thread.title: Man injured in semi crash on Interstate 90 near Dover
thread.title_full: Man injured in semi crash on Interstate 90 near Dover

author: Staff reports
title: Man injured in semi crash on Interstate 90 near Dover
text:
Man injured in semi crash on Interstate 90 near Dover
The driver had non-life threatening injuries.
DOVER TOWNSHIP, Minn. — While traveling on Interstate 90, a man was injured after his semi collided with the median near Dover on Thursday, Dec. 19, 2024.
The 2023 International Tractor semi was traveling west on the Interstate when it lost control and collided with the median around 11:20 a.m. Thursday, according to a Minnesota State Patrol crash report. The roads were snowy/icy.
ADVERTISEMENT
The driver, 26-year-old Xavier T Boelter of Urbana, Illinois, had non-life threatening injuries. He was transported to Mayo Clinic Hospital-St. Marys.
The National Weather Service reported “hazardous travel” conditions throughout the morning as snow continued Thursday. State Patrol reported 41 property damage crashes, six injury crashes, 17 vehicles off the road and seven jackknifed semis in the Rochester district, which represents the 11-county area, from 5 a.m. to noon Thursday.
The Minnesota State Patrol, Olmsted County Sheriff’s Office, St. Charles Police Department, Eyota Fire Department and Dover Fire Department responded to the Interstate 90 crash.
Evening snowfall timing update for this evening. Snow, heavy at times, will continue through the early evening from southeast Minnesota into southwest Wisconsin with accumulations of 1-3" of additional snow from 3-8 pm.
— NWS La Crosse (@NWSLaCrosse)[pic.twitter.com/JEY9Fr04hO][December 19, 2024]
ADVERTISEMENT
